meanings.definition: To replace one thing or person with another.
meanings.sent1: She is substituting the blue pen with a red one.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys substituting ingredients in recipes to create new flavors.
meanings.sent3: The cat is substituting the toy mouse for a real one.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the actor is substituting his lines with gibberish.
meanings.sent5: Substituting the broken bulb with a new one brightened the room.

meanings.definition: To act as a substitute or replacement.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, John will be substituting for the manager.
meanings.sent2: She is substituting for her colleague while he is on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The robot is substituting for the missing player in the game.
meanings.sent4: The teacher is substituting her regular coffee with tea today.
meanings.sent5: Substituting the old batteries with new ones made the remote work again.

meanings.definition: The act of putting one thing or person in the place of another.
meanings.sent1: His substituting of the damaged tire with a spare saved the road trip.
meanings.sent2: The substituting of the lead actor with an understudy went smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The sudden substituting of the main course with dessert surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The substituting of the old logo with a new design refreshed the brand.
meanings.sent5: The quick substituting of the injured player with a substitute changed the game dynamics.
